title: A Woe Oracle against Sennacherib
html:
The destroyer to whom Isaiah refers in this woe oracle is often identified as Sennacherib, the king of Assyria who attacked Jerusalem in 701 b.c. These prophecies also apply to transgressors of any age who "destroy" and "deal treacherously." The Lord destroyed Sennacherib and his armies and will continue to destroy all others who follow Sennacherib's pattern of evil.

Woe to thee that [destroy], and thou wast not [destroyed];
and dealest treacherously, and they dealt not treacherously with thee!
when thou shalt cease [destroying],
thou shalt be [destroyed];
and when thou shalt make an end to deal treacherously,
they shall deal treacherously with thee. (33:1)
